title.narrative: The Southeast Economic Recovery and Protection Project (SERAP)

description.narrative: Designed to respond to the mounting protection and relief needs of LRA conflict-affected communities in South-Eastern CAR, specifically the Mbomou Prefecture, the SERAP program builds upon the foundation of Mercy Corps’ protection programming in Rafai and surrounding areas to provide continued support to LRA conflict-affected survivors, including child protection and socio-economic support. The project is addressing the short-term food security needs of conflict-affected households through cash distribution, also helping vulnerable households recover their assets. Through Resilience Groups, Mercy Corps is helping vulnerable women and youth reintegrate socially and recover income-generating activities through financial literacy and vocational training, in addition to support to boost literacy and basic life skills. The program also ensures that IDPs and host communities continue to access protection services, including prevention and response to gender based violence.

Project Goal: The goal of this project is to increase the food security, enhance community resilience and strengthen the protective environment via community-based mechanisms for children, women and men affected by the LRA in the Mbomou prefecture, including survivors, escapees, and host communities.
Project Objectives: 1. Address the urgent short-term food security needs of LRA-affected IDP households and host households. 2. Strengthen agricultural livelihoods and increase income generation opportunities for LRA-affected IDP households to promote longer-term food security. 3. Ensure LRA-affected populations have continued access to immediate protection services. 4. Collect data in order to build knowledge of the humanitarian situation of LRA conflict-affected populations.
